meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a church.
meanings.sent1: The churchier building had stained glass windows and a tall steeple.
meanings.sent2: The churchier architecture of the cathedral stood out in the city.
meanings.sent3: The churchier design of the new library made it look like a mini cathedral.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was churchier than usual, with intricate lace patterns resembling cathedral windows.
meanings.sent5: The churchier atmosphere of the old chapel brought a sense of peace and reverence.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is more formal or conservative in religious practices.
meanings.sent1: She dressed churchier than usual for the Sunday service.
meanings.sent2: The priest spoke churchier during the special ceremony.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he felt churchier when wearing a tie.
meanings.sent4: The choir sang churchier than ever before, filling the hall with solemn melodies.
meanings.sent5: The congregation behaved churchier during the important event, showing respect and decorum.
